content: each side in the first row of the main body of the pattern ie dropping to 64 sts do bear in mind however that the main stitch pattern for the leg and foot is worked over four stitches so your stitch count after the ribbing should be divisible by four on the other hand you can get round the whole issue by doing either a one-by-one rib k1 p1 or two-by-two k2 p2 rib leg for the leg follow the main stitch pattern 18 times or to the length of your choice heel flap and gusset in order to keep the pattern consistent on the front of the sock the heel flap is worked on 31 stitches leaving 29 stitches for the instep front of foot those 29 stitches should begin and end on the first stitch of round 2 of the main stitch pattern this will centre your little trees page 3 forest of firs socks www blueammonitedesigns com heel flap working on one side of your sock only 31 sts complete an eye of partridge heel flap as follows row 1 *sl1 k1* repeat from * to * to end of the row k1 two knit stitches at end row 2 sl1 purl to end of row row 3 sl2 *k1 s1* repeat from * to * k1 one knit stitch at end row 4 sl1 purl to end of row repeat 9 times for a total of 36 row or to your desired heel flap length heel turn with the right side of the work facing you work the heel turn as follows row 1 s1 k16 ssk k1 turn row 2 s1 p5 p2tog p1 turn row 3 s1 k6 ssk k1 turn row 4 s1 p7 p2tog p1 turn continue adding one stitch between slip_stitch and ssk or p2tog on each row until all the heel stitches are used knit across your heel stitches then pick up and knit every slip_stitch on the left side of your heel flap if you like a bit more room in this gusset section or you tend to get a gap pick up an extra stitch between the heel flap and the instep place marker 1 work across the 29 sts for the instep front of the sock in pattern place marker 2 then pick up the same number of slip stitches on the right side of your heel flap gusset decreases round 1 knit to 3 stitches before marker 1 k2tog k1 slip marker and work across the front of your sock in pattern slip marker 2 k1 ssk k to marker 1 round 2 slip marker 1 knit to marker 2 slip marker knit to 3 stitches before marker 1 round 3 k2tog k1 slip marker 1 and work across the front of your sock in pattern slip marker 2 k1 ssk k to marker 1 repeat round 2 no decreases and round 3 with decreases until you have 60 stitches in total foot
